active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a zero-trust security model, how does Google Cloud KMS enable protection of data at rest and in transit across multi-cloud environments? Discuss trade-offs between Software-protected keys and HSM-protected keys, referencing real-world compliance scenarios like FIPS standards.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Google Cloud KMS (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cryptographic Solutions > Cryptographic Implementation > Cloud Cryptographic Services > Google Cloud KMS). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, 4 scaffolding layers, prior knowledge (basic crypto: symmetric/asym, rotation, envelope), big picture (zero-trust, data protection), concept map, and research context to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Incorporate university pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active recall, scaffolding from foundation to integration. Ensure completeness: Cover key management options (Google-managed vs. CMEKs; users have no control over Google-managed keys), protection levels (Software/HSM/EKM), Autokey, FIPS compliance, hands-on gcloud/console steps. Generate exactly 25 flashcards following the flashcard_schema: - Front: Engaging question (MCQ/cloze/short answer). - Back: Answer | Explanation (pedagogical rationale, layer/objective tie-in) | Source Context | Active Hook. - Distractors: Strictly follow protocol for plausibility/misconceptions. Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'source_context': '...', 'active_hook': '...'}}, ...]. Cover all Bloom's levels proportionally, voter priorities (e.g., 20% on protection levels), and layers evenly.
